name: Gray Hairless 4 Her Awareness Logo Shirt
description:
Still flying high from the success of their 2013  “Save The Women Not The Boobies®” campaign, breast cancer awareness nonprofit Hairless 4 Her Awareness, Inc. (H4HA), created PINK 365, an apparel line to promote breast cancer awareness within the urban community year round. The line kicked off with trendy high quality unisex t-shirts in three exclusive designs available at www.pink365apparel.com. 

The hip hop culture might lead one to believe that urban consumers tend to indulge in pricy labels instead of serious causes. To combat that notion, H4HA combined fashion and awareness to attract an untapped 
group of potential young urban supporters and inform them about breast cancer in a way that appeals to them. "I want to gain the attention of the young men and women whom aren't typically targeted to be supporters of breast cancer awareness by encouraging them to shop the cause," said founder Turquoise Johnson. She continued, "PINK 365 was created to standout when worn on the streets. We used a brighter pink in our designs because it is meant to get your attention, oppose to the usual soft breast cancer pink."
By the end of 2013, H4HA is looking for PINK 365 not only to be an awareness tool but also a popular apparel brand within the urban community; a community that is often overlooked by breast cancer organizations. H4HA is more than ready to bridge a gap between breast cancer awareness and the urban community. 

FOR ANY QUESTIONS OR COMMENTS EMAIL US: pink365apparel@gmail.com
